author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
7. The Great Chapter
65. The City
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Pubbe me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
segments.en: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:

segments.pli: ‘kicchā vatāyaṃ loko āpanno jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca.
segments.en: ‘Alas, this world has fallen into trouble. It’s born, grows old, dies, passes away, and is reborn,

segments.pli: Atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa.
segments.en: yet it doesn’t understand how to escape from this suffering, from old age and death.

segments.pli: Kudāssu nāma imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyissati jarāmaraṇassā’ti?
segments.en: Oh, when will an escape be found from this suffering, from old age and death?’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti, kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan’ti?
segments.en: ‘When what exists is there old age and death? What is a condition for old age and death?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:

segments.pli: ‘jātiyā kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇan’ti.
segments.en: ‘When rebirth exists there’s old age and death. Rebirth is a condition for old age and death.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho sati jāti hoti … pe …
segments.en: ‘When what exists is there rebirth? …
continued existence …
grasping …
craving …
feeling …
contact …
the six sense fields …
name and form …
What is a condition for name and form?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:

segments.pli: ‘viññāṇe kho sati nāmarūpaṃ hoti, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpan’ti.
segments.en: ‘When consciousness exists there are name and form. Consciousness is a condition for name and form.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho sati viññāṇaṃ hoti, kiṃpaccayā viññāṇan’ti?
segments.en: ‘When what exists is there consciousness? What is a condition for consciousness?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:

segments.pli: ‘nāmarūpe kho sati viññāṇaṃ hoti, nāmarūpapaccayā viññāṇan’ti.
segments.en: ‘When name and form exist there’s consciousness. Name and form are a condition for consciousness.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: paccudāvattati kho idaṃ viññāṇaṃ nāmarūpamhā na paraṃ gacchati.
segments.en: This consciousness turns back from name and form, and doesn’t go beyond that.

segments.pli: Ettāvatā jāyetha vā jīyetha vā mīyetha vā cavetha vā upapajjetha vā, yadidaṃ nāmarūpapaccayā viññāṇaṃ;
segments.en: This is the extent to which one may be reborn, grow old, die, pass away, or reappear. That is: name and form are conditions for consciousness.
Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
The six sense fields are conditions for contact. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.

segments.pli: ‘Samudayo, samudayo’ti kho me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi ñāṇaṃ udapādi paññā udapādi vijjā udapādi āloko udapādi.
segments.en: ‘Origination, origination.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho asati, jarāmaraṇaṃ na hoti;
segments.en: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no old age and death?
When what ceases do old age and death cease?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
‘When rebirth doesn’t exist there is no old age and death.
When rebirth ceases old age and death cease.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho asati jāti na hoti … pe …
segments.en: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no rebirth …
continued existence …
grasping …
craving …
feeling …
contact …
six sense fields …
name and form?
When what ceases do name and form cease?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
‘When consciousness doesn’t exist name and form don’t come to be.
When consciousness ceases name and form cease.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘kimhi nu kho asati viññāṇaṃ na hoti;
segments.en: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no consciousness?
When what ceases does consciousness cease?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
segments.en: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
‘When name and form don’t exist, there is no consciousness.
When name and form cease, consciousness ceases.’
Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: adhigato kho myāyaṃ maggo bodhāya yadidaṃ—
segments.en: I have discovered the path to awakening. That is:
When name and form cease, consciousness ceases.
When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.
When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease.
When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.

segments.pli: ‘Nirodho, nirodho’ti kho me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi ñāṇaṃ udapādi paññā udapādi vijjā udapādi āloko udapādi.
segments.en: ‘Cessation, cessation.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso araññe pavane caramāno passeyya purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇañjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ.
segments.en: Suppose a person was walking through a forest. They’d see an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by humans in the past.
Following it along,

segments.pli: Tamanugacchanto passeyya purāṇaṃ nagaraṃ purāṇaṃ rājadhāniṃ pubbakehi manussehi ajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ ārāmasampannaṃ vanasampannaṃ pokkharaṇīsampannaṃ uddhāpavantaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: they’d see an ancient city, an ancient capital, inhabited by humans in the past. It was lovely, complete with parks, groves, lotus ponds, and embankments.

segments.pli: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, puriso rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā āroceyya:
segments.en: Then that person would inform a king or their minister:

segments.pli: ‘yagghe, bhante, jāneyyāsi—ahaṃ addasaṃ araññe pavane caramāno purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇañjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ tamanugacchiṃ.
segments.en: ‘Please sir, you should know this. While walking through a forest I saw an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by humans in the past.

segments.pli: Tamanugacchanto addasaṃ purāṇaṃ nagaraṃ purāṇaṃ rājadhāniṃ pubbakehi manussehi ajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ ārāmasampannaṃ vanasampannaṃ pokkharaṇīsampannaṃ uddhāpavantaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: Following it along I saw an ancient city, an ancient capital, inhabited by humans in the past. It was lovely, complete with parks, groves, lotus ponds, and embankments.
Sir, you should rebuild that city!’

segments.pli: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, rājā vā rājamahāmatto vā taṃ nagaraṃ māpeyya.
segments.en: Then that king or their minister would have that city rebuilt.

segments.pli: Tadassa nagaraṃ aparena samayena iddhañceva phītañca bāhujaññaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ vuddhivepullappattaṃ.
segments.en: And after some time that city was successful and prosperous and full of people, attained to growth and expansion.

segments.pli: Evameva khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, addasaṃ purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇañjasaṃ pubbakehi sammāsambuddhehi anuyātaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, I saw an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.

segments.pli: Katamo ca so, bhikkhave, purāṇamaggo purāṇañjaso pubbakehi sammāsambuddhehi anuyāto?
segments.en: And what is that ancient path, the ancient road traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past?
It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho so, bhikkhave, purāṇamaggo purāṇañjaso pubbakehi sammāsambuddhehi anuyāto, tamanugacchiṃ;
segments.en: This is that ancient path, the ancient road traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.
Following it along, I directly knew old age and death,
their origin,
their cessation,
and the practice that leads to their cessation.
Following it along, I directly knew rebirth …
continued existence …
grasping …
craving …
feeling …
contact …
the six sense fields …
name and form …
consciousness …
Following it along, I directly knew choices,
their origin,
their cessation,
and the practice that leads to their cessation.

segments.pli: Tadabhiññāya ācikkhiṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ upāsakānaṃ upāsikānaṃ.
segments.en: Having directly known this, I told the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

segments.pli: Tayidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ iddhañceva phītañca vitthārikaṃ bāhujaññaṃ puthubhūtaṃ yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitan”ti.
segments.en: And that’s how this spiritual life has become successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.”

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha the story of how his awakening came about through investigation into dependent origination. He compares it to man discovering and ancient city, lost and overgrown with weeds.
